subject: Gardening
title: The Irish Potato Famine: Seed Diversity Lost
description: A quick win: understand The Irish Potato Famine: Seed Diversity Lost.

hook.text: Ireland grew one potato variety. When blight struck, it destroyed everything. One million people died.

buildup.text: The Irish Lumper potato was high-yielding and easy to grow. Farmers planted it exclusivelyâ€”genetic monoculture.

discovery.text: Phytophthora infestans arrived from America. With no genetic diversity to resist it, the entire crop collapsed in weeks.

twist.text: Peru grew thousands of potato varieties, many blight-resistant. Ireland had traded diversity for short-term yield.

climax.text: The famine proved seed monoculture is a gamble. High yields today, catastrophe when the one weakness is found.

punchline.text: One variety, one disease, one million dead. Diversity saves.

quiz.question: What fundamental agricultural mistake caused the severity of the Irish Potato Famine?
options: Ireland imported contaminated seeds from American farms
Reliance on a single potato variety created genetic monoculture vulnerable to disease
Farmers refused to use available fungicides against the blight
